Support to help you establish your career and achieve your goals
The opportunity to work on innovative projects within a variety of Canada’s top companies
A competitive compensation package with support for continuous learning

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet
Description:
Alteo est à la recherche d'un Data Scientist pour un poste permanent basé à Montréal (à distance). En tant que Data Scientist, vous serez chargé d'analyser de grandes quantités d'informations brutes et de trouver des modèles qui permettront d'améliorer la croissance continue de notre client. Vous serez appelé à définir, analyser, rapporter et conseiller sur les tendances opérationnelles stratégiques à travers l'entreprise, tout en développant et en maintenant des rapports durables et évolutifs et des données analytiques et des modèles prédictifs. Vous travaillerez également en étroite collaboration avec notre équipe d'ingénierie des données pour garantir l'intégrité de la couche analytique et de consommation de notre pipeline de données. Dans ce rôle, vous devez être très analytique et avoir un don pour le traitement des données, la modélisation des données, l'analyse, les mathématiques et les statistiques, tout en appliquant les meilleures pratiques en matière d'exploration de données et d'apprentissage automatique. Responsabilités :
Travailler avec les parties prenantes internes pour développer, exécuter et tester différentes expériences de croissance qui ont un impact significatif sur la conversion dans tous les entonnoirs (attraction,, activation, acquisition, rétention, recommandation et monétisation).
Développer des modèles analytiques avancés et les déployer de manière transparente dans nos opérations.
Administrer notre plateforme d'apprentissage automatique, y compris la curation et la maintenance des modèles. - Être responsable de la disponibilité et de la livraison de nos pipelines de données opérationnelles et analytiques.
Collaboration avec l'équipe d'architecture des données d'entreprise pour identifier de nouvelles sources de données et les transformer en modèles de données réutilisables.
Analyser diverses sources de données afin d'obtenir des informations exploitables.
Saisir, organiser et hiérarchiser les besoins des utilisateurs finaux et les traduire en informations analytiques inédites.
Convertir les informations en un format de narration pour tous les publics.
Développer et maintenir des protocoles pour la manipulation, le traitement et le nettoyage des données de l'entreprise.
Contribuer à la définition et au maintien d'une structure et d'un processus durables de diffusion de l'information.
Participer à l'amélioration continue des processus décisionnels au sein de l'équipe d'analystes.
Effectuer diverses tâches quotidiennes à la demande du directeur de l'intelligence économique. Profil :
Master dans un domaine quantitatif, de préférence en statistiques, mathématiques, science des données ou intelligence artificielle.
5+ ans d'expérience professionnelle dans l'apprentissage automatique, l'analyse avancée, et la livraison de modèles prédictifs de qualité production.
Doit avoir une expérience dans une entreprise de logiciels SaaS
Peut démontrer une expérience dans les thèmes d'exploration de données tels que la classification, la régression, l'apprentissage de règles d'association, le clustering/segmentation, la détection d'anomalies, l'apprentissage séquentiel de motifs, la prévision de séries chronologiques, les tests A/B, etc.
Doit démontrer une connaissance et une expérience solides dans la fourniture d'informations prédictives sur les parcours numériques des clients, de l'attraction à la fidélisation des clients.
Connaissance avérée du nettoyage et de l'exploitation de big data semi-structurés, et de leur conversion en schémas de données analytiques et de reporting.
Expérience de l'utilisation de Python, R, SAS ou SPSS.
Expérience de l'utilisation de plateformes de science des données et d'apprentissage automatique telles que Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Azure Synapse, GCP, AWS, H20.ai ou IBM Watson.
Expérience dans les référentiels de big data tels que AWS S3, Google BigTable ou Microsoft Azure.
Expérience de l'utilisation d'entrepôts de données analytiques tels que RedShift, BigQuery et Snowflake.
Maîtrise de la visualisation et de la présentation d'informations à l'aide de Power BI, Data Studio, Tableau, R Shiny, Plotly ou MatPlotLib.
Expérience des bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres, MongoDB, BigQuery, etc.
Est intimement familier avec la méthodologie CRISP-DM
Connaissance des meilleures pratiques d'ingénierie logicielle tout au long du cycle de développement, y compris les méthodologies agiles, les normes de codage, les revues de code, la gestion des sources, les processus de construction, les tests et les opérations.
Peut communiquer clairement des informations techniques à un public non technique.
Peut travailler de manière autonome et hiérarchiser les tâches afin de terminer le travail en temps voulu, avec un minimum de directives.
Capacité à agir rapidement, à tirer des conclusions immédiates et à formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les performances de l'entreprise.
Une éthique de travail éprouvée qui permet d'obtenir les résultats souhaités, avec un excellent sens des affaires et d'excellentes compétences en gestion de projet
Collaborer efficacement avec les utilisateurs finaux internes et les équipes interfonctionnelles pour résoudre les problèmes, mettre en oeuvre de nouvelles solutions de reporting, et livrer avec succès en respectant des normes élevées.
Idéalement bilingue (l'anglais est indispensable, le français est un atout).

Title: Data Engineer (Remote)
Industry: Information Services Computer Software
Description:
Location - Remote, North America

About Our Team:
KAR Data Services is looking to expand our enterprise data delivery team as we continue to grow our data platform in support of a mission of digital transformation in automotive wholesale markets. The data engineering team is responsible for the ingestion and persistence of data supporting an array of data products supporting KAR Global’s automotive wholesale business.
 KAR Data Services has a polyglot data model using many cutting-edge data platforms including AWS Redshift for Data Warehouse, Elastic Search for location-based searching, and Postgres for transactional data and product delivery. Our delivery framework is comprised of Python/Docker on ECS, Spark on EMR, and Jenkins for CI/CD and a roadmap focused on strategic data integrations and products and expansion of platform capabilities including Snowflake and Informatica.
 About Our Candidate:
 This candidate should be a self-starter who is interested in learning new systems/environments and passionate about developing quality supportable data service solutions for internal and external customers. We highly value natural curiosity about data and technology that drives results through quality, repeatable, and long-term sustainable database and code development. The candidate should be highly dynamic and excited by opportunities to learn many different products and data domains and how they drive business outcomes and value for our customers.
 What You Will Be Doing:
Members of the data engineering team participate daily in ceremonies of Agile sprint to help design, plan, build, test, develop, and support KAR Data Services’s data products and platforms consisting of Pythion ETL pipelines and Postgres, Redshift, Dynamo DB, and Elastic search, and Snowflake databases. Our team works in a shared services delivery model supporting seven lines of business including front-end customer-facing products, B2B portals, mobile applications, business analytics, and data science initiatives.
Responsibilities include:
Work with product, data science, analytics, and engineering teams to learn project data needs and define project scope.
Design and planning of data services solutions on the enterprise data Platform.
Building and delivery of Python/Docker feed framework data pipeline jobs and services.
Contribute to the Data Engineering team delivery framework including building of re-usable code, implementing industry best practices, and maintain a common delivery framework.
Monitoring, maintenance, documentation, and incident resolution of scheduled production data jobs supporting internal and external customers data needs.

What You Need to Be Successful:
5+ years experience Postgres SQL development including functions, stored procedures, and indexing or equivalent (required).
Experience in production data management in high availability product delivery ODS / RDBMS or equivalent (required).
Experience planning and designing maintainable data schemas (required).
Experience with Python, Docker, and data warehouse environments (preferred).
Experience using Github / Jenkins (CI/CD) / Artifactory / PyPy or comparable delivery stacks (preferred).
Experience with Postgres, Elastic Search, AWS EMR, and AWS ECS (preferred).
Experience with AWS Redshift, MPP, or Dynamo DB (preferred).
Experience with Kinesis/Kafka (preferred).
Experience working with large enterprise data lakes / Snowflake (preferred).

KAR Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. KAR Global is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

Title: HR DATA ANALYST- Dubai, UAE
Industry: Computer Software Staffing & Recruiting Financial Services
Description:
Are you passionate about finding and placing top talent and you know how to reach and engage candidates on a human level?

We are Cobblestone trading, part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. We are looking for curious and innovative HR Data Analysts who will help us build our foundations and aim for the moon. They will live by the mantra "Hire the stars, keep the most effective, grow them to be the best".

About Us

Cobblestone Energy is an independent trading firm founded in London in 2017. Although we have experienced very strong growth so far, we are still near the start of our journey. We have ambitions to go a lot further.

Energy in one form or another is fundamental to almost all the world's economic activities. By understanding the demand, supply, and logistics of these commodities, we can better understand the world.

We specialize in the proprietary trading of the short-term wholesale electricity markets across Europe. We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

Over the years we have grown organically. As part of our journey to be the best in all markets we enter, we would like to welcome a Data Analyst into our HR (Human Resources) team. For this role we are looking for someone who has a passion for numbers and ability to use data to make decisions. HR experience is not mandatory however an interest in HR is important.

Cobblestone Values
Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence.


Job Description

As a HR Data analyst, you will be responsible for executing our strategy for talent acquisition and continuously enhancing our selection process using data and candidate insights. Hiring is a key aspect of our operations and people play the greatest role in our advancement and success. We are looking for an ambitious and highly efficient resources that can deliver results. A professional that can match our hiring process with the best candidates across the world to ensure that we have the most talented individuals for our team.

What We Offer In This Role
A full-time position on our HR team
Opportunity to work closely with the management team.
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
Great compensation and rewards
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
An opportunity to work on new things from scratch and make independent decisions.


Responsibilities
Gather, interpret, and visualise complex data to develop actionable steps that improve HR processes, optimise results, and enable data-driven decision-making.
Prepare dashboards by analysing and presenting core HR data including headcount statistics, turnover metrics, recruitment metrics and workforce KPIs to identify significant trends or key issues.
Support in developing and implementing talent acquisition strategies and hiring plans.
Conduct in depth analysis on the selection process and use the insights to make improvements to the process.
Identify and partner with recruitment agencies and job sites.
Build strategic tie ups with reputed colleges for campus placement.
Manage job postings on social media.
Meet agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for hiring.
Lead employment branding initiatives.
Take steps to ensure a positive candidate experience.
Manage other HR activities as required.


Requirements
Strong numerical and research skills.
Passion for data analysis.
Proficient in the use of social media and job boards.
Willingness to understand the duties and competencies of different roles.
Excellent communicator.
Strong EQ skills.
Good Organization and reporting skills.
A passion for building talented teams.
Resilience and a determination to succeed.
Independent thinkers with growth mindset.
Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly.
Strong sense of integrity.
Personal values that match our company values.

Desirable Qualities
1-2 years of experience in recruiting and talent acquisition.
Experience in full cycle recruiting and sourcing.
A passion for developing employer branding.
Proficient in the use of social media.
Experience in data processing, excel, SQL, databases.
Working knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and databases

Job Location:

The role will be based in our Corporate office in Dubai.

Office Location:

Jumeirah Business Centre 2, Cluster V, Jumeirah Lake Towers, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Financial Services
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Description

S&C Advent, a leading provider of award-winning software and services for the global investment management industry, is seeking for a Data Scientist.The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications:
2-3 years’ experience as a data analyst, data scientist, or related role.
Experience with Python and R is required.
Prior development experience with Salesforce, Cognos, and Oracle Financial is a plus.
Experience in the FinTech and cloud space is a plus.
Familiarity with data engineering techniques (gather, prepare, cleanse, and transform data) for analysis.
Strong collaboration and team working skills.
Strong obsession to put clients at the center of everything SS&C Advent does.
The Job Responsibilities Are As Follows
Learn about and become a subject matter expert on our operational data, data models, and applications.
Work collaboratively with our outsourcing service teams to define data strategy, identify critical data elements, and create data governance on those critical data elements.
Work with various stakeholders across the organization on our data collections practices to ensure we collect and analyze the right data.
Establish an effective closed feedback loop by aggregating and automating the data analysis process.
Formulate hypotheses and run experiments using our datasets.
Derive actionable insights by leveraging our datasets, programming languages, and AI tools.
Identify areas that can drive better customer experience.

Title: Senior Data System Analyst - Big Data
Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Financial Services
Description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The role of the data designer is to work with leading-edge technologies such as sensors and control electronics, sophisticated planning and decision support systems, big data infrastructures, advanced analytics, deep learning. This role is responsible for delivering of data services in support data goverance, engineering and machine learning practices. The role requires a deep understanding of the data analysis techniques and data model design. The data designer brings technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, then process, design and present it in ways to help people, businesses, and organizations make better decisions. The role ensures data integrity and normalization, and provides designs to support the development of data pipelines. The roles requires an individual that is able to develop a specification to support the data pipelines for both batch and real time data streaming.

Main Responsibilities

Definition & Delivery of data assets
Design, develop data assets to be consumable from a data lake, and data warehouse, to support operational reporting, data science and self serve analytics
Data design must be ensure the integrity of all data accuracy
Participate in (and eventually proposing) simplification initiatives to allow for more effective data management to change the conversation from tactical to strategic which is insight and action orientated focused
Obtains the requirements from the business using user stories, for the data pipelines design that will enable faster, better, data-informed decision-making within the business
Leads innovation through exploration, benchmarking, making recommendations, and implementing data technologies and data design models
Analyzing proposed application/system changes and making recommendations for approval
Identify sources systems, develops knowledge of business context, becomes SME of data source, works with data engineers/scientists to provide expertize on the data sources being analyzed
Performs ad-hoc analyses of data stored in the business’s databases/data warehouse and writes SQL scripts, to analyze data
Troubleshoots data issues within the business and across the business and presents solutions to these issues
Must be able to test and apply test processes for data management practice.
Illustrate and Support a Variety of Optimized Analytics Delivery Capabilities

Working Conditions
This role may require occasional business travel in accordance with CN policy for meetings
Requirements

General Experience
Minimum 7-10 years overall work experience
Between 5 and 7 years of experience in support the development of data warehouse, and data lakes
Must have experience in building data models, for data warehouse and data lake storage
Ideal if the person has design experience in supporting real time streaming, modeling for non sql database
Has developed requirements into user stories, worked with developers for grooming the requirements
Has provided conceptual, logical and physical data models
Has capture business transformation rules
Must be able to do data wrangling, cleans the data, develop insights from data assets\
Expert ability to identify data requirements, gaps and assess end-to-end data requirements
Excellent Communication skills to build alliances and gain consensus with key stakeholders to promote Test Data Management best practices
Education/Certification/Designation
Bachelor’s degree specializing in Mathematics and Statistics / Computer Science / Business Analytics / or other quantitative field, related degree or equivalent experience
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Has worked in a Data Warehouse or Data lake organization
Experience in Data Design, Data Analytics or Data Science
Exposure to Data modeling experience, and data architecture best practices
Experience with relational database modeling techniques
Experience with dimensional modeling techniquesExperience with coding, using Data Bricks, spark streaming, Python, Data Factory, SnowFlake
Expert in SQL development further providing support to the database design, data flow and analysis activities
Advising staff and users on database design practices
Nice to have experience with unstructured data, withe background with using data from of social media, video feeds or audio.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group
Experience in doing design for real time data streaming and loading
Data profiling, data extraction and breaking down data to a domain driven model
Strong test strategies, using advance SQL skills to support the performance tuning of the extraction process,
Ability to create strategies for loading, purging and retaining data
Assets
Tools used ideally Kafka, spark, mulesoft, postgress, graphql, Snowflake, Databricks and spark
Experience working across both business and technology (5+ yrs.)
Written presentation experience; presenting insights in plain language and images (5+ yrs.)
Experience in understanding complex businesses questions and framing the right analytical question to solve a business problem (5+ yrs.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group
The ability to learn quickly, problem solve/troubleshoot, work independently and in a team
Exposure to principles of change management, and scrum agile
Experience in leading and participating in business workshops
Ability to promote business intelligence, analytics, and reporting vision
Exposure to delivering commercially beneficial insights and analytics strategies
Exposure to hands-on support to orientate analytics around delivering value back to the business
Willingness to work on multiple projects at one time
Exposure to building analytical and quantitative analysis models (5+ yrs.)
About CN

As a leading North American transportation and logistics company, CN is a true backbone of the economy. With a team of approximately 25,000 railroaders, our focus is on moving both our company and the economy forward. We transport US$200 billion worth of goods annually for a wide range of business sectors from resource to manufactured products to consumer goods, across a 20,000-mile network spanning Canada and mid-America. CN is the only Canadian company listed in the Transportation and Transportation Infrastructure sector of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI). Launched in 1999, the DJSI World represents the gold standard for corporate sustainability. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Title: Data Engineer
Industry: Marketing & Advertising Information Technology & Services Computer Software
Description:
About HelloFresh

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 8 years we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the meal kit delivery market.

So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of encouraged and empowered home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active in 12 different countries across 3 continents. In Canada, our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal. We have launched facilities across the country and have recently added Chefs Plate to our team!

We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse FreshFam enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

If you would like to join a dynamic and highly motivated team and work in a high-growth industry where you can have an impact and make a difference every single day, then join us!

About The Role

We are growing our Data team to take our data modeling and automation to the next level. Our Data team supports HelloFresh Canada in delivering best-in-class data products to grow our business. We are hiring a Data Engineer to focus on designing scalable and automated data flows, using a variety of big data tools and platforms (Spark, Airflow, Databricks, etc.), and build our infrastructure and automation capabilities.

You Will
Build data tools and services to support data scientists, business analysts, and data analysts across the organization
Design and automate end-to-end data products and automation flows: from data ingestion for data science / analytical models, to business management applications (e.g. purchase order tracking and receiving)
Data Transformations: Maintain and update logic for data pipelines (aggregations, selections, etc.)
Data cleaning / enrichment: identifying and managing data issues to ensure data is clean and accessible (eg. bug fixes, backfills)
Help design our data model for critical tools (materialized views, joins, etc.)
Implement data product performance and issue monitoring tools
Advocate for data quality, data governance and data product thinking


You Have
Bachelor of Science in a STEM discipline
2-4 years’ data engineering experience is required
Proficient in Python (with knowledge of OOP) and SQL (query optimization).
Experience with testing and general DevOps practices for data pipelines
The ability to design, implement and deliver maintainable and high-quality code using best practices (e.g. git/github, secrets, configurations, yaml/json)
Knowledge of data structures (DataFrames, RDDs, Dataclasses) and data formats (CSV, JSON, Parquet, Avro, ORC)
Knowledge of software design patterns, and building highly scalable solutions preferred


Why You'll Love It Here
A competitive salary and company benefits
75% discount on HelloFresh and Chefs Plate boxes
Partial top-up for parental leaves
We trust and support you - take ownership of your work and push your ideas from inception to execution
We want to see you grow - we support your career progression and provide learning and development opportunities
We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. You’ll work with fun, energetic, and supportive teams.
We’ve kept up the work-hard, play-hard energy virtually. From team socials to HQ Wellness Wednesdays to holiday and milestone celebrations, you’ll have plenty of opportunity to connect socially with teammates across the company.


When We Return To The Office

To ensure the health and safety of our employees during COVID-19, our HQ employees are currently working remotely! When we return to the office, you’ll love:
Our bright and functional space located in the heart of downtown Toronto
Our test kitchen, where our recipes are tested on-site, so there are delicious meals constantly flowing!
Our newly renovated employee lounge decked out with a movie projector, comfy couches, board games, a ping pong table, and local craft beer on tap!
Our gorgeous rooftop patio, with a perfect view of the CN Tower while you enjoy lunch outdoors!
Our fully stocked kitchen with fresh fruit, healthy and not-so-healthy snacks, sparkling water, cold brew coffees, and more. (Are you seeing a pattern yet? Hint: We love food!).

You are welcome at our table.

At HelloFresh, we are committed to building and nurturing an inclusive community for our employees. We value diverse skills and experience, and strongly encourage applications from our Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC) community, as well as people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities.

HelloFresh is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing an accessible recruitment process. Upon request, we will provide accommodation for candidates at any stage.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Industry: Marketing & Advertising Computer Software Internet
Description:
Who We Are

We’ve taken the “ordinary” world of home services and made it memorable by bringing exceptional customer service into the mix. With our three uniquely branded home services franchises - 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, and Shack Shine - we make the ordinary businesses of junk removal, painting, and house detailing exceptional by being leaders in customer experience and innovation. It’s all in our name O2E = Ordinary 2 Exceptional!

Since we’re in the business of being exceptional, that means we’re always looking for exceptional people to join our team. Could you be one of them?

This is where you come in

O2E Brands is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing team! As part of the Business Intelligence department, you will provide reporting, analysis, and insights to improve business decision making across the organization. You will be a driving force for data-driven decisions and inform the business on strategic decisions based on your analysis and reporting.

What People Say About You

I love analyzing numbers and data to uncover opportunities to drive the business forward. I have a unique ability to interpret complicated data and turn it into clear, concise, and meaningful dashboards for different audiences. I have a clear vision of the big picture but am also able to dive into details. I am a great listener and I also ask smart questions to get to the root of the problem and to find ways to grow the business. I'm passionate about coaching others in data visualization best practices and building a culture of data driven decision making. I have a relentless attention to detail and pride myself on providing cohesive user experiences for data consumers
Work with all areas of the business including marketing, finance, sales, and operations to organize, analyze and report on data
Design, develop, maintain and optimize reports and dashboards
Provide fact-based data-driven insights and analysis to formulate meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Create ad hoc reports measuring the performance of strategic initiatives
Identify trends in the data, and proactively communicate them in a concise manner
Proactively identify additional key performance indicators to measure and support new business initiatives.
Develop and maintain forecast models
Engaging and supporting a group of embedded data analysts throughout the organization
Preparing content and facilitating meetings for our Tableau Analyst Group
Experience manipulating and analyzing large amounts of data
Effective communicator, presenter, and facilitator with strong business acumen
Demonstrated ability to analyze and synthesize data and to formulate actionable insights
Demonstrated ability to work with all levels of the organization
Comfortable coding in R, Python and SQL
Expert data visualization skills with Tableau
Proven experience with enterprise data warehouses (Redshift), BI tools, project methodology,
Experience with Salesforce, particularly reporting and dashboards is a big plus
Take a Sneak Peek Into Why That Is, Here

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 12 times..

Check us out on social!

At O2E Brands we know that great talent comes in many forms and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please reach out to our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

Title: Technical Business Analyst (Remote, Canada)
Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet
Description:
Collective[i] is a pioneer in digital sales transformation. Collective[i] provides companies with critical intelligence that is essential for sales teams to compete and succeed in the modern age. Our mission is to end economic uncertainty and enable companies around the world to predict, manage and grow their revenue.

Collective[i] is on the hunt for a BI or Technical Business Analyst who will play a key role in supporting client implementations and account management. This is a North America based remote position. You will be part of a small, but growing, collaborative client success team. You will use your analytical and critical thinking skills to curate and analyse data from a variety of sources to produce content and insights that illustrate the positive impact Collective[i] delivers to clients.

You are a self-driven problem solver, with strong, proven skills in data analytics, visualization and presentation building. You may have previously held a Technical Business Analyst or BI Analyst position in Sales Operations or an agile project delivery team. You have the skills and curiosity to thrive at finding patterns, correlations, causations, anomalies and translate into meaningful business insights. You then incorporate those insights into great looking, compelling presentations that highlight business impact, value and strategy.

You are execution focused and have a reputation for delivering work on-time with a high degree of focus on accuracy and repeatability. What’s more...you are a good soul, passionate about succeeding and love being in the trenches with your fellow teammates in a fast paced agile work environment.

What you will do
Work collaboratively with Implementation, Client Success Management, and Client Success Data Engineering to strategize on project goals and define requirements
Design and produce internal and client facing analytical BI content and presentations featuring key business insights and data visualizations
Curate, validate and analyze data sets from multiple sources including CRM, Google Analytics and Collective[i]’s proprietary data warehouse using repeatable, scalable methods
Collaborate and create professional, high quality slides and infographics using data visualization and BI content
Provide insights to engineering and product teams to influence product strategy and roadmap
Support the client onboarding process by collaborating with QA resources to resolve issues and drive quality
Being a fully remote position, you are comfortable with collaboration via digital tools like chat and video-conferencing while maintaining self motivation and accountability
What tools are in your tool kit
2-5+ years as a BI analyst or technical business analyst
Proficient at database queries, synthesizing data and multidimensional data analysis using tools such as Python, R or equivalent.
Experience with enterprise BI/reporting platforms such as Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, MicroStrategy is a plus
Excellent communication skills. You can write succinct, impactful summarizations for sales executives and C-suite
Experience working with or functional knowledge of CRM systems like Salesforce.com or Microsoft Dynamics is referred
Experience working with B2B sales organizations in some capacity is a plus
Strong organization and time management skills
Experience working on agile projects and collaborative teams
Functional knowledge of AI & ML is a bonus
What makes you - you
Love great tech and data - intrigued with AI/ML
Self-motivated, take charge as a driver for change - best idea on the table wins
Big picture thinker - don’t solve for one solve for many
Results oriented - metrics matter
Hands on and team oriented
Value integrity and trust
Drive to succeed with the team (Knights of the round table)
Nimble and adaptable, roll with the punches, ability to fail fast and pivot
Good human - you play for the team and check your ego at the door
More about Collective[i]:

Collective[i] is passionate about using ML, RPA and other AI technologies along with a network to automate the myriad of tasks that distract sales professionals from selling and provide timely intelligence that helps to grow revenue. Our revenue optimization engine is one of the most transformative technologies to hit the enterprise since CRM. Founded and managed by the early teams behind LinkShare (purchased for $425m) and Overstock (NASDAQ:OSTK), Collective[i] is headquartered in NYC with offices in Silicon Valley and Montreal, Canada.

Recent Press

Wall Street Journal, Here’s What’s New in Enterprise Tech

Wall Street Journal, Smart Sales Tools Seek Better Data

Wall Street Journal, The Morning Download: Artificial Intelligence Transforms the Sales Process

Wall Street Journal, New Fund Firm Cuts Pay If Managers Don’t Beat the Market

Information About The Founders

Tad Martin

Stephen Messer

Heidi Messer

Title: Associate Marketing Data Analyst
Industry: Marketing & Advertising
Description:
WHO WE ARE
Labelium is a Digital Performance Agency driving business growth through data-driven strategies in more than 16 countries. Since 2001, our 300 skilled team members have been supporting hundreds of local and international companies to develop and/or secure a leading position in their markets. Our clients trust us to design and implement innovative, performance-driven and cost-efficient digital strategies, and ensure winning e-commerce and e-retail programs. Labelium’s clients agree that our forward-looking, collaborative and strategic approach sets us apart from other agencies. Amongst Labelium's 400+ clients, we count leading companies such as LVMH, L’Oréal, Carrefour, David’s Tea, Löle, Christie’s, Rudsak, ba&sh, Dior, Warner Bros, RailEurope, Club Med.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a keen interest in learning and working on diverse new projects and enjoy problem solving with the help of technology. 
The Associate Data Analyst will be a key member of the dynamic Data Marketing Team at Labelium, supporting Labelium’s clients and the media team. The ideal candidate has a passion for data, reporting, analytics, and tracking associated with digital marketing.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Client & Project Management
Be the main point of contact for external clients on a range of analytics, dashboarding, and data projects
Handle requests from the media team through a ticket system, staying on top of multiple fast paced projects, including those involving experts (client’s side, contractors, Labelium global experts)
Data Collection & Analytics
Audit and setup of Tag Management Systems (mostly Google Tag Manager) to support clients’ needs, including implementation of data architecture (pushing data in the dataLayer, building JavaScript queries, etc.)
Implementation of tagging plans while providing business recommendations for clients (Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook tags)
Run data maintenance to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Data Visualization & Reporting
Creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards to ensure media performance 
Conception of internal reports and trackers to support the Labelium media team
Data Consulting Projects
Build custom data pipelines for reporting, including custom APIs and data processing
Setup reporting back-ends combining data from multiple sources and platforms
Attribution projects, sentiment analysis, geo-testing

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree 
1-2 years’ experience in data & analytics / digital marketing
Experience with Data Studio
Experience working with digital marketing platforms and analytics tools such as Google Analytics
Experience with Python, R, or SQL 
Knowledge of statistical methods and A/B testing (using R or Python packages)
Experience with one or more tag management tools such as Google Tag Manager, Adobe Dynamic Tag Manager, TagCommander, Tealium or other equivalents
Strong user of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Proficiency visualizing data and dashboarding with Tableau, Qlik or other equivalent tools
Bilingualism (French & English) is an asset
Google AdWords, Facebook Ads Manager, and Bing Ads knowledge is an asset
Knowledge of basic SEO is an asset
Knowledge of basic HTML and JavaScript is an asset

DESIRED ATTRIBUTES AND CORE VALUES
Positive attitude, energetic, team player
Experience in digital marketing
Strong attention to detail, reliable, highly organized, autonomous, resourceful
Strong problem solving and time management skills
Change agent & emotional intelligence
Inclusive and equity focused

WHY CHOOSE LABELIUM
Generous paid time off package
Group insurance coverage and virtual employee support services
Individualized & curated learning programs
Pro-bono opportunities (Philanthropy program)
Supportive and collaborative work environment
Dynamic entrepreneurial environment

Labelium has offices in Montreal and Toronto. We are fully remote while restrictions are in place and will consider candidates for all full time positions based out of either city. 

As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Senior Analyst
Industry: Higher Education
Description:
Posted by
Kacey McCuen
Human Resources Advisor at Queen's University
Reporting to the Director, Information Technology Management, with functional accountability to the senior analyst leads, the Senior Analyst is responsible for managing data, application programming, data integration, reporting and project support for the Office of Advancement. This includes advanced programming in PL/SQL, report and dashboard creation, supporting the needs of the data warehousing and business intelligence environment, assisting in the definition and prioritization of data, reporting requests, and training staff on supported applications. The incumbent will execute tasks and activities with a professional, results-focused, collaborative approach, and will communicate in a proactive manner.
 The Senior Analyst will also be responsible for providing high-level program analysis, including identifying ways of enhancing existing processes and the development of new processes. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for the design, development, implementation, and administration of the data used by the Office of Advancement. The Senior Analyst will support the training efforts of new Advancement programmers on all areas of the Advance application and proper programming standards and procedures developed in-house.
 As the Senior Analyst you will:
Designs, codes, tests and debugs programs or application software using a variety of languages and software platforms. Analyzes and revises existing system logic difficulties as necessary, modifies procedures and documents all program changes.
Determines client business requirements and translates needs into actionable work plans. Ensures that needs and standards are met to users satisfaction and in accordance with Queen’s policy.
Participates in requirements gathering, application design meetings, and preparing technical specifications.
Collects data from multiple sources and integrates into existing frameworks.
Participates and makes recommendations in planning, designing and carrying out a project or task from start to finish with well-defined objectives and outcomes. Develops plans; establishes timelines and delegates tasks; seeks feedback; tests, revises and implements.
Works to agreed quality standards and specifications, and assists others to do so as well.
Provides technical support and services to assigned area. Assists with the identification and resolution of complex application, database design and maintenance problems. Provides support and maintenance for designated information systems used by the Office of Advancement.
Designs, builds and maintains data visualizations and high-performance analytical data sources.
Assists with the development and and delivery of training to staff on how to use new applications. Prepares and maintains training documentation for the operation of software, hardware and inventories.
Works with representatives from other areas where applications cross system boundaries to determine integration options and provide training and/or knowledge transfer about specialized systems as required.
Promotes a culture of inclusion that embodies Advancement values, with a commitment to the university’s equity, diversity, accessibility, and inclusion initiatives designed to foster an inclusive, supportive, and welcoming work environment for individuals with diverse backgrounds and identities.
Provides work direction and technical/functional guidance to staff. Occasionally coordinates workflow.
Keeps current with programming languages and platforms within program and application software.
Undertakes other duties as required in support of the unit and/or department.
 The Senior Analyst also calls for:
 Four-year bachelor’s degree required (preferably at the honours level).
Consideration will be given to equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum three years of relevant successful technical experience in the development, implementation and maintenance of information systems, preferably in a university environment.
Demonstrated knowledge, proven experience and ongoing learning required with advanced programming techniques and technology including proven expertise in Oracle databases, Unix/Linux based operating systems, and exceptional programming skills using SQL, PL/SQL, and HTML. Ability to use and implement new technologies to the Office of Advancement’s advantage.
Data warehousing and business intelligence exposure, including query, report and dashboard, and ETL design.
Proven ability to interpret business needs into technical terms, translate business rules and processes into technical solutions, and to communicate well complex solutions to less technical users.
Report writing skills and visualization creation using Crystal Reports, Tablueau or equivalent. 
Experience working effectively with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, Service Desk) and GitKracken.
Advanced knowledge of the business analysis discipline. Demonstrated training and/or certification considered to be an asset, including Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), Certificate of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA) or equivalent. 

Consideration will be given to an equivalent combination of education and experience.
To apply or for additional details on this continuing appointment, please visit Career Q, on our Human Resources website at:https://clients.njoyn.com/CL4/xweb/xweb.asp?clid=74827&page=jobdetails&jobid=J0521-0157&BRID=EX200914&SBDID=20758&LANG=1

by June 13, 2021, quoting competition J0521-0157. The University thanks all who express an interest in this position and advises that only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
 The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ persons The University will provide support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. If you require accommodation during the interview process, please contact Carla Ferreira Rodrigues, at ferreirc@queensu.ca or 613-533-6771.
 One of Canada’s leading universities, Queen’s has a long-standing reputation for academic excellence, research and a diverse and vibrant learning environment. With its strong tradition of public service, the University has helped to shape Canadian values and policies, educating notable political and cultural figures.
 Queen’s University is located in the heart of the community in historic Kingston, midpoint between Montreal and Toronto, and the nation’s capital.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance
Industry: Information Technology & Services Automotive Financial Services
Description:
LIFE AT BRP

We create innovative ways to move - on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.

Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 12,600 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.

www.brp.com.

Follow Us On
LinkedIn @BRP;
Twitter @BRPnews;
Facebook @BRPinfo.

WHY JOIN THE TEAM?
Make a significant contribution to BRP's digital transformation
Position yourself in a career plan that will make you a resource person in data analysis
Be part of a multifunctional project team that deploys state-of-the-art business solutions
Work closely with financial controllers and multiple implementation teams of SAP S/4 and its ecosystems


Your Main Functions
Assimilate the master data elements already established by the project team in place
Assimilate the reporting requirements already shared by the business to the project team in place
Lead/co-lead design and development workshops for financial reporting
Work closely with data stewards and SAP consultants to find the right reporting data points
Coordinate reporting activities with analytic, business and project teams
Share finance requirements to the data analytic team
Prioritization and sequencing reporting developments
Validate functional specification documents developed by the consultants
Ensure SOX controls are respected
Strong involvement in the validation with key internal stakeholders to guarantee high quality reporting deliverables
Work with stakeholders and project team to resolve reporting issues
Develop training material and give training to super-users in connection with master data


Your Qualifications And Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, or related field
5+ years of related work experience
Experience with SAP FICO Master Data
Technical expertise in database design and data modeling
Strong Microsoft Office skills are required
English strong written and oral communication skills are required, French is an asset
Strong analytical and systems thinking skills
Ability to learn and make decisions quickly
Ability to work independently and proactively
Ability to work in teams, influence others and manage conflict
Ability to work based upon specific timelines and dependencies

Title: Data Analyst Team Lead
Description:
Posted by
Nicole Edwards-Hayman
President at Peoplesyde Human Resource Group
Job Description:        Data Analyst Team Lead
Reporting to:             President
Direct Reports::         5
Salary:                        Competitive Compensation Package commensurate with experience  
 About LBM Partner Services
LBM Partner Services offers an amazing workplace culture that is collaborative and supportive; where people share knowledge, skills are valued, and people bring creative ideas and solutions forward every day! LBM Partner Services is a London-based business providing tech solutions for the Lumber and Building Materials industry in Canada and the US.

At LBM we are always expanding our product and technology offerings!  This means we are continually bringing new, innovative products to market through exciting technology initiatives to help our customers. 

LBM Partner Services is based out of Ontario’s newest and coolest community at WestFive, in London, Ontario where you can work, live, play and shop in a sustainable environment.  The West Five community has it all. 450,000 sq. ft. of commercial space. A dynamic Central Park where you can play, catch a concert, yoga or just relax and people watch. 2,000 townhomes, condos, and apartments. Interconnected walkways, trails, and open green spaces. A safe, walkable, pedestrian-centric design with a vision for 100% energy efficiency.

We are looking to grow our team AGAIN by hiring a Data Analyst Team Lead who has experience working directly with customers, the technical skills to coach and mentor a highly independent and collaborative team of IT Consultants and can bring new approaches to tracking and standardizing current processes
This is an incredible opportunity to lead a highly collaborative team in a client-driven business. 

Key responsibilities
To coach, mentor and support a team of IT Consultant Specialists
Promote and sell existing products or services to LBM clients,
Develop new IT solutions that can be standardized to solve client’s business challenges and provides additional value to clients
Work together to standardize existing tools with clear goals, project plans and timely completion of consulting projects with attention to details, accurately and on time
Monitor projects for accuracy of Microsoft SQL Code and Python language 
Maintain a highly collaborative, inclusive workplace culture where all employees are always valued and treated with dignity and respect
Communicate with the President about progress on critical, high impact projects and tasks
Role out new client-focused task/project management tool to lay a foundation for future growth
Conduct quality control audits to reduce errors, provide feedback to employees to improve the accuracy of information
Be the point of contact for escalated issues from customers, balancing client expectations and the needs of the business 
 Skills and Attributes
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Leadership Skills to motivate and inspire a team to perform at their best
Professional verbal and written communication skills
Excellent relational and social skills to serve clients confidently
Not afraid to jump in and learn independently
Proactive and takes initiative

Technical Skills, Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science
3-5 years related IT experience leading a remote and on-site team of consultants
Proficient in writing Transact SQL Views, Stored Procedures, jobs

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

Job Description

Data Engineer

The Analytics & Insights Team at AIR MILES® is looking for a Data Engineer to join our team.

The A&I Team is a group of 100+ individuals working across different disciplines within Data & Marketing Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Products, and Market Research. We work collaboratively with our internal stakeholders and our external business partners across industries such as Grocery, Banking and Retail to design, develop and execute loyalty marketing analytics solutions using one of Canada’s largest transactional databases and best-in-class technologies. Come join us on our journey to becoming Canada’s most recognized loyalty program.

Benefits And Perks At AIR MILES

Recognized as Canada’s Top Employer

There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career. That’s what sets us apart.

How Will You Create Impact?

Let’s Talk About You

Experience with Agile methodologies as well as familiar with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Travis, github)

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Online Media
Description:
Posted by
Deepmala Sachan
Talent Acquisition Specialist at AutoTrader.ca
Send InMail
Want to work somewhere awesome?
Awesome is who we are and awesome is what we do!
Trader Corporation is the team behind Canada’s leading automotive marketplace, AutoTrader.ca, as well as a world class digital advertising business. We are a technology driven company that creates compelling solutions for our users and dealer customers. We are expanding and looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our team
 
About the role:
The Data Scientist will provide thought leadership, and best practice approaches to support AutoTrader's initiatives in the area of advanced statistical and mathematical modeling. You will leverage expert capabilities in segmentation, optimization and statistical modeling to identify the appropriate analytical approach for a given client issue and build the solution with direction on implementation.
 
What you’ll do:
Pricing and Product Management
analyze existing pricing strategies and simulate potential changes to understand impact to customer segments, products, and revenues.
perform statistical analysis to evaluate critical areas for revenue improvement
forecasting and optimizing customer penetration levels in order to maximize revenue
develop predictive models through all stages in the product life cycle
Customer Modeling and Segmentation
develop and maintain models to identify best acquisition targets
work with key internal stakeholders in Marketing and Sales to implement and continually back test and refine models as necessary
develop and maintain models to identify customers at risk of churning from AutoTrader; identify key churn drivers
Extract, clean and transform customer data for the purposes of analysis, modeling
Sales Optimization:
develop and maintain models to identify the optimal frequency of customer contact and best sales/ service channel by customer segment
work with the various teams to integrate predictive models within Salesforce and other Trader systems as needed
analyze data to identify process and people gaps where data is essential for predictive models
Thought Leadership:
develop best practices and standards for data modeling and management
develop comprehensive testing and measurement programs that quantify and optimize models developed with each successive execution
Collaborate with teams to identify and secure data needed to increase the effectiveness of predictive models
Identify data required to enhance and improve model accuracy; provide input and advice to MI/BI teams as part of data roadmap with IT

Must haves:
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Quantitative Science or Computer Science
5 years’ related work experience in statistical and mathematical model development, quantitative analysis, interpretation.
4 years' experience in product management.
3 years’ experience with pricing models and concepts (such as price elasticity)
Expert level SQL querying skills; fluent in statistical programs (i.e., R, Python)
Working knowledge of Office Suite Applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access, Outlook).

Ideal Candidate:
Strong oral and written communication skills
Must be able to conceptualize and relay it to other technical/non-technical team members and stakeholders.
Excellent team player with interpersonal skills
Ability to collaborate with other teams to achieve organization’s goal
 
What is in it for you:
Vibrant, passionate and enthusiastic team
Competitive base salary with performance bonuses
Several additional bonuses available
President’s Club recognition program and annual trip
Development and growth programs
Opportunities for advancement
Retirement benefits
Employee & Family Assistance and Wellness Program
Gym membership discounts

Do we have your attention now? If so, we would love to hear from you!

At Trader Corporation, we welcome everyone to apply. We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our workplace, where every team member feels valued.

Title: Data and Analytics Programmer
Description:
ABOUT THIS POSITION
Digital Extremes is currently looking for a Data and Analytics Programmer to join our team. You will be working with passionate, highly intelligent game developing ninjas in a collaborative fast paced environment. Your primary responsibility will be supporting DE with your technical skills by the creation and maintenance of game code that supports insights, metrics and improved users experiences. You’ll also be called on to support and drive data related initiatives with key stakeholders throughout DE enabling iterative learning and growth. Expect this position to be challenging, fun and filled with opportunities for personal growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Help the team drive initiatives in the game code
Add and maintain in game metrics
Coordinate and support in game testing
Validate new game features tracking
Build out ETL pipelines
Research and drive new and creative solutions to data acquisition and organization challenges

Experience in Python, C++, PHP, SQL, Lua and software development.
Experience with working in large code bases
Experience using Mongo and Postgres servers
Experience with using Linux/Ubuntu

2-10 years of industry experience
Strong Independent problem solver
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Strong sense of ownership over their work and projects
Able to be flexible to the different types of work and shifts in priorities
A passion for video games and understanding of gaming culture  

ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II. The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 50 million registered players on PC, PS4™, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch™. For more information about Digital Extremes, visit www.digitalextremes.com. To sign up for Warframe, visit www.warframe.com.
 WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of “Canada’s Top 100 Employers”. We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of a career with Digital Extremes include:  

Competitive salary with bonus opportunities
Excellent benefits and paid time off
Matching RRSP plan
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Professional development and career support
Fitness and parking/transit subsidies
Daily lunches prepared onsite by our in-studio Executive Chef and professional kitchen staff
All-day snacks and drinks, sleep pods, massage chairs, cold brew, dog therapy days and more  

JOIN US 

Digital Extremes is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Information Technology & Services Computer Software Internet
Description:
About DataRobot

DataRobot is the leader in enterprise AI, delivering trusted AI technology and enablement services to global enterprises competing in today’s Intelligence Revolution. DataRobot’s enterprise AI platform democratizes data science with end-to-end automation for building, deploying, and managing machine learning models. This platform maximizes business value by delivering AI at scale and continuously optimizing performance over time. The company’s proven combination of cutting-edge software and world-class AI implementation, training, and support services, empowers any organization – regardless of size, industry, or resources – to drive better business outcomes with AI.

DataRobot has offices across the globe and funding from some of the world’s best investing firms including Alliance Bernstein, Altimeter, B Capital Group, Cisco, Citi Ventures, ClearBridge, DFJ Growth, Geodesic Capital, Glynn Capital, Intel Capital, Meritech, NEA, Salesforce Ventures, Sands Capital, Sapphire Ventures, Silver Lake Waterman, Snowflake Ventures, Tiger Global, T. Rowe Price, and World Innovation Lab. DataRobot was named to the Forbes 2020 Cloud 100 list and the Forbes 2019 and 2020 Most Promising AI Companies lists, and was named a Leader in the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Advanced Machine Learning Software Platforms Vendor Assessment. For more information visit www.datarobot.com, and join the conversation on the DataRobot Community, More Intelligent Tomorrow podcast, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Data Scientist

DataRobot is the world’s premier AI and data science platform. Our Data Scientists are experienced applied data scientists, passionate about using machine learning to achieve real-world results. As a Data Scientist at DataRobot, you will collaborate closely with DataRobot customers to bring expertise in data science and the DataRobot platform to help customers achieve their organization’s objectives with AI. You’ll work with clients in a range of industries on diverse use cases, and with both business (executive, line of business) and technical (data science, engineering, analytics) stakeholders.

Responsibilities
Be the DataRobot product and data science subject matter expert to our customers by leading implementation, advising on the viability and execution of use cases, helping to develop Joint Success Plans (JSP), and leading the execution of them.
Ensure the success of our customers by helping to achieve quantifiable Value Realisation Indicators - Leading to renewals / expansions furthering the growth of both our customers and DataRobot
Act as a trusted advisor on AI across the customer lifecycle; enable customers to solve complex data science problems using DataRobot – including problem framing, data preparation, scripting, model building, model deployment, model management, and output consumption
Work side-by-side with our sales and success teams to help our customers achieve their JSP and quantify the business impact of it
Identify opportunities to expand our relationship with customers
Act internally as the voice of the customer to the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams
Present at conferences and/or help create other marketing content


Requirements
4-5+ years of real-world business experience in a data science role
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative subject
Hands-on experience building and implementing machine learning or AI models
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders to ensure that machine learning solutions deliver successfully on business outcomes
Strong customer interaction, communication, writing and interpersonal skills
Excellent project management and organizational abilities
Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of data
Fluency with scripting in Python or R (preferably both)
Regional travel may be required

Desired
Advanced degree
Familiarity with consultative sales process in the analytics marketplace
Familiarity with data platform technology integrations
Experience dealing with complex customer organizations

Title: Research Analyst
Industry: Public Relations & Communications Marketing & Advertising Online Media
Description:
Description

Position

at Hill+Knowlton Strategies

Hill+Knowlton Strategies is seeking a Research Analyst to join our Data+Analytics team in Canada. This role presents a unique opportunity to apply and grow your primary research skills by working with a diverse base of influential clients within a dynamic global organization. This role can be based in Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal or Vancouver.

As a Research Analyst with the Data + Analytics team you will:
Collaborate with clients and H+K client teams to understand their primary research needs and define projects.
Familiarize yourself with research issues by reviewing background documentation and some academic literature.
Develop quantitative and qualitative data collection instruments (e.g., survey questionnaires, interview guides, focus group guides).
Conduct one-on-one interviews and focus groups.
Analyze quantitative and qualitative data.
Conduct secondary research (e.g., Statistics Canada data, trends) and coherently summarize information.
Produce reports that include detailed findings, insights, and implications for clients.
Present findings to clients and H+K client teams.
Support client teams to identify new opportunities for primary research work in their projects.
Technical Experience & Skills

Here’s what you’ll need to get here:
Excellent writing skills.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong data visualization skills (e.g., presenting survey results in PowerPoint charts).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Google Data Studio, Displayr, Tableau, PowerBI) is an asset.
A good understanding of statistics, research methodologies and statistical packages (e.g., questionnaire design, survey sampling).
Proficient with statistical analysis tools like SPSS
An understanding of data analytics is an asset.
The ability to speak and write in French at a professional level is an asset.
Soft Skills
Intellectually curious.
Interested in public policy, government, politics, history, etc.
Energetic self-starter with a willingness to learn.
Excellent time management skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Strong presentation skills.
Other
Three to five years of direct experience in primary research, including survey research.
A university degree.
Currently all H+K employees are working remote until our offices re-open

Hill+Knowlton Strategies is dedicated to employment equity, welcomes diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from all qualified applicants. If you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please reach out to us.

We thank all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

About Us

Hill+Knowlton Strategies Canada (H+K) is a public relations and public affairs consultancy providing services to local, multinational and global clients from its eight offices across the country.

The firm works with clients to solve complex communications challenges and deliver award winning campaigns and is focused on continued innovation for the industry. H+K offers deep sector knowledge and breadth of public relations and public affairs expertise including specialists in health + wellness, technology, government + public sector, energy + industrials, consumer packaged goods, financial + professional services, food + drink, retail + leisure and sports.

Globally, Hill+Knowlton Strategies Inc., has offices in more than 40 countries as well as an extensive associate network; and it is a member of WPP (NASDAQ: WPPGY), one of the world’s largest communications services groups.
