Title: Intern Business Analyst
Company: Societe Generale Corporate and Investment Banking - SGCIB
Industry: Financial Services Investment Banking
Description:
Responsibilities

Internship starting as soon as possible

Work Environment

The opportunity we are offering is to join the Projects and Transformation Office in Montreal. You will join a team whose role is to provide an internal consulting service covering all departments of the bank. The implementation of Société Générale's transformation strategy in Canada is at the heart of our mission.

Project Implementation, Process Review, Change Management, PMO, Design Thinking and Business Analysis are just a few of the areas of expertise we develop in the Montreal office.

Your day to day mission

You will assist the project team in the implementation of strategic programs.

SG Canada is a human-sized team, you will develop your knowledge on a wide range of functions (Operations, KYC, Finance, Legal, Risk, Human Resources, IT...) and will develop an expertise on a large project.

You work within the well-defined perimeter of a project where you conduct missions in line with the internal project methodology. Very client-oriented, you regularly monitor the satisfaction of the sponsor.

You assist the project managers in their missions. To carry out your mission, you will:
Assist with day-to-day delivery of transformation projects for internal clients, and supporting deliverables using a variety of methodologies, technologies and tools
Work closely with internal client in understanding key business issues.
Gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutions.
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to project activities for stakeholder discussions.
Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within Société Générale
Profile Required

Education and skills:
Knowledge of Project methodologies.
Strong analytical skills and ability to communicate the results of analysis and problem solving.
Knowledge of investment banking products and processes is a plus.
Exemplary written and oral communication skills both in English and French
Ability to organize, monitor and prioritize workload
Comfortable in a world of constant change.
Client-oriented
You are pursuing a Business Administration or Math/Computer Science Bachelor or Master Degree in a Canadian University.

You have a good level on Excel and Power Point.

Would be a plus
Lean Six Sigma, Design Thinking Certification, Agile or other project methodologies is a plus.
Business insight

Societe Generale opened its Canadian headquarters in Montreal in 1974 to offer its financial services to corporations, financial institutions and governments. The Toronto and Calgary offices were opened in 1978 and 2006 respectively.

We now employ over four hundred people, both in the traditional banking sector (investment banking, funds and trading activities) and in the field of information technology, with the opening of our SG Montreal Solutions Centre subsidiary which, thanks to its geographical location and its cultural diversity, provides computer support and development for the New York and Paris teams.

Interested in Corporate Social Responsibility matters such as contributing to the protection of the environment or giving back to the local communities?

Several Employee Resource Groups have been put in place at Societe Generale in Canada to help you achieve a sense of fulfilment towards causes that matter the most to you!

Get on board and get involved! We are here to support you!

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Computer Hardware Computer Software Information Technology & Services
Description:
Our research team’s core mission is protecting Microsoft 365 users across devices, identities, applications, and data via cross-category, tightly integrated threat protection for sec ops and sec-admins. If you believe that cyber-attacks can happen without ever dropping an executable on disk and that a forward rule and a token can do more damage than Powershell, this role may be for you!

Protecting M365 users is a big challenge, but with the signals we have built today in Microsoft Defender for Office 365 and Microsoft Cloud App Security, we are the best equipped company in the world to realize this opportunity and fundamentally change the security world, both for our customers and for attackers.

While each of the individual Microsoft Defender security products provide best in class protection across endpoints and cloud, combining all of these optics and protection capabilities brings the complete attacker behavior into focus like never before, allowing innovative new detection and response approaches across the entire attack graph and providing SOCs unparalleled scale, reduced time-to-investigate, and reduced time-to-remediate across their digital estate. To help design our single federated protection solution spanning all M365 cloud security products, we are seeking a Senior Data Scientist with AI skills, security knowledge, and a growth mindset. We want your help innovating and designing our solution across Microsoft 365’s security portfolio.

Responsibilities
Partner with geographically distributed product teams and security researchers to identify, understand, and address security challenges across devices, identities, applications, and data assets.
Formulate and build data processing pipelines to fuel data-driven research (e.g., statistics, machine learning, & data mining) and create new innovations across Microsoft 365’s broad security signals.
Partner closely with fellow practitioners to iteratively refine systems as research evolves.
Deliver reusable components to research and product teams by communicating to a variety of stakeholders through documentation and presentation.
Facilitate tech transfer by partnering with product teams to deliver new product capabilities.
Contribute to active engagement with the security ecosystem through papers, presentations, blogs, and/or external collaborations.
Invest in your growth as a security practitioner by actively seeking new knowledge from the data, from your colleagues, and from external communities

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
5+ years of data engineering experience with a background in fueling rigorous data-driven inference methods (such as statistics, machine learning, and sound experimental design).
2+ years of cyber security experience with a background in modern risk matrices (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK) and emerging enterprise threats (including insider risk and attacks against Azure/AWS and cloud services such as O365, Exchange, and Azure AD).
BS or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, or information technology.
Excellent programming skills (e.g., C#) and proficient at working with and manipulating large data sets (i.e., billions of events per day), using modern big-data systems (e.g., Azure storage/compute), and interfacing with scientific tools (e.g., Python, Spark/Scala, or Azure ML).
Excellent cross-group and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate the business need for product improvements.

Preferred Qualifications
Cyber security experience with a background in modern risk matrices (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK) and emerging enterprise threats (including insider risk and attacks against Azure/AWS and cloud services such as O365, Exchange, and Azure AD)
Industry recognized author of security research papers, blogs, presentations, or books.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Government Administration
Description:
Posted by
Alexander Soley, MIRHR, CHRL, CRSP
People & Culture Business Partner at Electrical Safety Authority
Send InMail
The Electrical Safety Authority is seeking a Data Scientist to work within a team of data analysts and develop the core algorithms and models that will be used to predict relevant safety outcomes and guide business decisions.

About the Job
The Data Scientist will join be an integral part of our analytics team, working alongside analysts and business users to design cutting-edge analytics solutions that help optimize processes, improve our outputs, and help the organization reimagine how a modern regulator does business. The role will apply data mining techniques, conduct statistical analysis, and build high-quality prediction systems to support data-driven decision-making, which produces high-quality outcomes. Our team is small and agile, and you’ll collaborate with very smart, fun, and driven colleagues.


Job Type: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Competitive Salary
Defined Benefit Pension Plan
Dental Care
Disability Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Extended Health Care
Life Insurance
Vision Care
Wellness Program


About Us
The ESA is one of Ontario's leading employers. If you choose to join our team, you will be entering a safety and development-focused environment where we will care about YOU as a member of our team and as an individual. We take care of our team members with an industry-leading benefits package and a defined-benefit pension plan, not to mention our competitive salaries.

We will help you build on your strengths, appreciate your diversity, provide opportunities for your development, and challenge you to be your best. We will make sure you are clear on your accountabilities and have the right resources, systems, and tools to achieve and succeed in your role.

About You
The Data Scientist needs to be curious and have a passion for data; in particular, they must have the ability to use data analytics to inform and guide business direction.
Ability to communicate effectively through oral presentations and written reports.
You can provide support to teams across the company, including regulatory, operations, financial, legal as well as people and culture with insights gained from analyzing internal and external data, i.e., health, social media, weather, and census/demographic data.
You are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.
Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills

Data Cleaning and Mining Skillset
Responsible for cleaning data and managing unstructured datasets. Utilize SQL and other programming languages as necessary to clean, merge, aggregate, and add structure to disparate datasets. Work with members of the IT team who will be managing aspects related to data warehousing and storage. Ability to identify how new data sources can be mined, merged, aggregated or used in conjunction, with existing assets, through collaboration with multiple team members.

Quantitative Analysis
Build, test, and deploy statistical models, such as linear or logistic regressions. Ability to understand a business problem and identify the applicable statistical technique to resolve the problem. Knowledge of multivariate techniques (e.g., principal components analysis and factor analysis) and their implications. Ability to work with a multi-disciplinary team to formulate hypotheses and conduct appropriate analyses to test hypotheses. Investigate new data sources and use open datasets to solve complex problems.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of quantitative theories around client safety behaviors and triggers in use of analytics, and be able to communicate, oral and written, effectively the analytical use cases both internally and externally.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Dash, Plotly, D3.js, GGplot, etc. that integrate various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Leads projects from start to finish with some oversight from Supervisor.

Machine Learning
Knowledge of the key principles of Data Science and Machine Learning and experience applying them. Advanced competence with programming languages and data science toolkits including, among others, Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PySpark), R, Weka, MatLab and query languages such as SQL, Hive, and Pig.
Make recommendations on machine learning techniques and be able to work with disparate datasets to test and implement solutions.
Clearly communicate the relative strengths and weaknesses of different approaches to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Responsible for the development of additional machine learning projects through collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Design, build, implement & test machine learning models such clustering, decision tree learning, time series, Naive Bayes, artificial neural networks, etc., and ship deployment-ready versions into production.
Utilize predictive model methodology and identify new data sources/patterns that further enhance machine learning models to drive business value.
Develop innovative solutions to machine learning problems such as sample selection bias, supervised and unsupervised learning using common data science toolkits, such as Python, R, Weka, MatLab.

Computer Skills
Comprehensive computer skills including, programming experience, database management, data management, spreadsheet analysis, and online research.
Experience utilizing Statistical Packages such as SAS, Stata, JMP, and Minitab.
Experience creating Data Visualizations using Power BI or Tableau.
Thorough understanding of Python.
Experience with KNIME is an asset.

Education:
Successful completion of a four-year university education with a Bachelor of Science or Administration or computer science or sociology or by having the equivalent level of education.

Experience:
4 years of progressively responsible experience in data science, computer science, or adjacent fields (such as epidemiology).

Title: Associate Threat Analyst | Remote, Canada
Industry: Computer & Network Security Information Technology & Services
Description:
Posted by
Cicily Petralie
Talent Acquisition Partner at Optiv Inc
Send InMail
At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.

In your role at Optiv, you’ll be inspired by a team of the brightest business and technical minds in cybersecurity. We are passionate champions for our clients, and know from experience that the best solutions for our clients’ needs come from working hard together. As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. We’re proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world.

Job Description

The Associate Threat Analyst will provide intrusion/incident monitoring and detection utilizing customer provided data sources, audit and monitoring tools at both the government and enterprise level. An Associate Threat Analyst is required to be flexible and adapt to change quickly. The Associate Threat Analyst will work closely with our Threat Analyst to service customers through our Managed Detection and Response offering.

How You'll Make An Impact
Analyze, document and report on potential security incidents identified in customer environments
Work with partners to maintain an understanding of security threats, vulnerabilities, and exploits that could impact systems, networks, and assets
Provide triage on various security enforcement technologies including, but not limited to SIEM, anti-virus, content filtering/reporting, malware prevention, firewalls, intrusion detection systems, web application firewalls, messaging security platforms, vulnerability scanners etc.
Perform knowledge transfers, document, and triage client’s issues regarding mitigation of identified threats
Provide ongoing recommendations customers on best practices
Actively research current threats and attack vectors being exploited in the wild
Utilize defined SOP’s and KB’s
Qualifications

Title: Data Scientist
Industry: Government Administration
Description:
Posted by
Alexander Soley, MIRHR, CHRL, CRSP
People & Culture Business Partner at Electrical Safety Authority
Send InMail
The Electrical Safety Authority is seeking a Data Scientist to work within a team of data analysts and develop the core algorithms and models that will be used to predict relevant safety outcomes and guide business decisions.

About the Job
The Data Scientist will join be an integral part of our analytics team, working alongside analysts and business users to design cutting-edge analytics solutions that help optimize processes, improve our outputs, and help the organization reimagine how a modern regulator does business. The role will apply data mining techniques, conduct statistical analysis, and build high-quality prediction systems to support data-driven decision-making, which produces high-quality outcomes. Our team is small and agile, and you’ll collaborate with very smart, fun, and driven colleagues.


Job Type: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Competitive Salary
Defined Benefit Pension Plan
Dental Care
Disability Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Extended Health Care
Life Insurance
Vision Care
Wellness Program


About Us
The ESA is one of Ontario's leading employers. If you choose to join our team, you will be entering a safety and development-focused environment where we will care about YOU as a member of our team and as an individual. We take care of our team members with an industry-leading benefits package and a defined-benefit pension plan, not to mention our competitive salaries.

We will help you build on your strengths, appreciate your diversity, provide opportunities for your development, and challenge you to be your best. We will make sure you are clear on your accountabilities and have the right resources, systems, and tools to achieve and succeed in your role.

About You
The Data Scientist needs to be curious and have a passion for data; in particular, they must have the ability to use data analytics to inform and guide business direction.
Ability to communicate effectively through oral presentations and written reports.
You can provide support to teams across the company, including regulatory, operations, financial, legal as well as people and culture with insights gained from analyzing internal and external data, i.e., health, social media, weather, and census/demographic data.
You are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.
Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills

Data Cleaning and Mining Skillset
Responsible for cleaning data and managing unstructured datasets. Utilize SQL and other programming languages as necessary to clean, merge, aggregate, and add structure to disparate datasets. Work with members of the IT team who will be managing aspects related to data warehousing and storage. Ability to identify how new data sources can be mined, merged, aggregated or used in conjunction, with existing assets, through collaboration with multiple team members.

Quantitative Analysis
Build, test, and deploy statistical models, such as linear or logistic regressions. Ability to understand a business problem and identify the applicable statistical technique to resolve the problem. Knowledge of multivariate techniques (e.g., principal components analysis and factor analysis) and their implications. Ability to work with a multi-disciplinary team to formulate hypotheses and conduct appropriate analyses to test hypotheses. Investigate new data sources and use open datasets to solve complex problems.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of quantitative theories around client safety behaviors and triggers in use of analytics, and be able to communicate, oral and written, effectively the analytical use cases both internally and externally.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Dash, Plotly, D3.js, GGplot, etc. that integrate various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Leads projects from start to finish with some oversight from Supervisor.

Machine Learning
Knowledge of the key principles of Data Science and Machine Learning and experience applying them. Advanced competence with programming languages and data science toolkits including, among others, Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PySpark), R, Weka, MatLab and query languages such as SQL, Hive, and Pig.
Make recommendations on machine learning techniques and be able to work with disparate datasets to test and implement solutions.
Clearly communicate the relative strengths and weaknesses of different approaches to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Responsible for the development of additional machine learning projects through collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Design, build, implement & test machine learning models such clustering, decision tree learning, time series, Naive Bayes, artificial neural networks, etc., and ship deployment-ready versions into production.
Utilize predictive model methodology and identify new data sources/patterns that further enhance machine learning models to drive business value.
Develop innovative solutions to machine learning problems such as sample selection bias, supervised and unsupervised learning using common data science toolkits, such as Python, R, Weka, MatLab.

Computer Skills
Comprehensive computer skills including, programming experience, database management, data management, spreadsheet analysis, and online research.
Experience utilizing Statistical Packages such as SAS, Stata, JMP, and Minitab.
Experience creating Data Visualizations using Power BI or Tableau.
Thorough understanding of Python.
Experience with KNIME is an asset.

Education:
Successful completion of a four-year university education with a Bachelor of Science or Administration or computer science or sociology or by having the equivalent level of education.

Experience:
4 years of progressively responsible experience in data science, computer science, or adjacent fields (such as epidemiology).

Title: Associate Threat Analyst | Remote, Canada
Industry: Computer & Network Security Information Technology & Services
Description:
Posted by
Cicily Petralie
Talent Acquisition Partner at Optiv Inc
Send InMail
At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.

In your role at Optiv, you’ll be inspired by a team of the brightest business and technical minds in cybersecurity. We are passionate champions for our clients, and know from experience that the best solutions for our clients’ needs come from working hard together. As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. We’re proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world.

Job Description

The Associate Threat Analyst will provide intrusion/incident monitoring and detection utilizing customer provided data sources, audit and monitoring tools at both the government and enterprise level. An Associate Threat Analyst is required to be flexible and adapt to change quickly. The Associate Threat Analyst will work closely with our Threat Analyst to service customers through our Managed Detection and Response offering.

How You'll Make An Impact
Analyze, document and report on potential security incidents identified in customer environments
Work with partners to maintain an understanding of security threats, vulnerabilities, and exploits that could impact systems, networks, and assets
Provide triage on various security enforcement technologies including, but not limited to SIEM, anti-virus, content filtering/reporting, malware prevention, firewalls, intrusion detection systems, web application firewalls, messaging security platforms, vulnerability scanners etc.
Perform knowledge transfers, document, and triage client’s issues regarding mitigation of identified threats
Provide ongoing recommendations customers on best practices
Actively research current threats and attack vectors being exploited in the wild
Utilize defined SOP’s and KB’s

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Industry: Computer Software Information Technology & Services Hospital & Health Care
Description:
We’re looking for a driven Senior Data Analyst to join our growing team at AlayaCare. If you’re interested in helping us build the future of mobile healthcare, this job is for you.

We are building a workforce management system allowing private home-care agencies around the world to manage their employees (scheduling, client health records, billing, payroll and reporting). We are also building other exciting complementary products (mobile apps for care workers, remote patient monitoring and family portal).

Every single member of the close-knit team located in Montreal, Toronto, Victoria and Sydney is committed to building the best product possible to change the home-care industry. To achieve this ambitious goal we work hard, making sure our users providing more than 500,000 care visits a day work efficiently.

Position Summary

AlayaCare is looking for an analytical person with an interest in SaaS companies to build and maintain the reporting infrastructure to support our clients’ internal decision making. Our embedded analytics stack is Snowflake, dbt, and Looker and you and your teammates will be the main contributors to our standardized analytics offering. Our clients will use what you built daily to make data-driven decisions that will directly impact patients’ health.

In This Role You Will
Automate report building for the clients of AlayaCare
Extract, Transform, Load data from multiple sources
Ensure accuracy and reliability of data, sourced from our different platforms
Design and implement accessible, high-impact visualizations that clearly communicate results, elucidate patterns, promote accountability, generate actionable insights, and facilitate decision making
Support integration of event tracking data from multiple platforms
Produce technical and user documentation
Deliver concise and meaningful reporting to cross teams
Lead, plan and execute BI projects to meet business objectives
Coach other data analyst on LookML best practices


About You
Business degree or any other relevant university degree (Computer Science, Math and Statistics, or Engineering
2+ years' experience as BI specialist working with clients (you will have to gather requirements from clients and figure out standard reporting packages)
1+ years' experience with Looker (from writing LookML to building dashboards)
1+ years working with SQL (we’re dbt users)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable business initiatives and reports
Prior experience with ETL jobs
Autonomous and strong organizational skills
Team player and ability to thrive in a fast-paced and performance-driven environment
Knowledge of Snowflake


More About Us
We are a fast-growing company with offices in Canada, US and
Australia and a team of over 470 employees
We’ve been recognized as one of the top growing companies in Canada
We are mission-driven and live by our values


What We Offer
Supportive and Collaborative Environment
Career Growth and Development
Health and Wellness Activities
Health Benefits Package
Flexible Vacation Policy

If you want to explore AlayaCare further, please visit our website www.alayacare.com.

Thank you for your interest in AlayaCare!

Title: Automotive Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, Ontario

Pay: $17/hr.

The Role

The primary function of the Automotive Data Analyst is to obtain, compile, analyze, interpret, research, code, and test for presentation all ordering, pricing, and technical information needed by Autodata/Chrome Data Systems from the Automotive Industry. The Automotive Data Analyst 1 must apply highly specialized knowledge of automotive vehicles and the variations of each manufacturer, as well as keep track of numerous details and their inter-relationships to develop a coding structure that makes the Autodata/Chrome Data product display accurate information with every possible set of variables. Each Data Analyst is ultimately responsible to ensure the Autodata/Chrome Data content “Gold Standard”.

Responsibilities
During the introductory training period, the Automotive Data Analyst 1 is responsible to access training tools, and participate in practice content assignments
Gain understanding of the department and industry which is necessary to develop personal priorities and timelines and hit deadlines within departmental schedule
Participate in entry and testing updates to company products
Review and analyze source documents from the manufacturer to identify discrepancies, inaccuracies, or missing content.
Accurately enter and/or test incentive vehicle data
Enter and test up to mid-level complexity vehicles for multiple OEM’s
Responsible to help the team achieve established goals, as well as completing individual responsibilities in a timely manner
May work on special projects, depending upon available resources and appropriate skill levels
Receive and respond to customer reports of errors and proactively respond with corrections and status updates in a professional manner


Qualifications
Successful completion of the Automotive Analyst training
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Post-secondary education would be an asset
Able to work well under pressure and to excel in a constantly changing environment
Strong self-management and analytical abilities
Very high accuracy and attention to detail is required
Self-motivated and able to work within a team
Computer skills – MS office, excel, word
Time management skills, organized and able to meet deadlines
This role requires flexible hours (including OT) which may at times include early mornings, late nights and weekends


The merger of Autodata Solutions with J.D. Power – announced in December of 2019 – created a valuable combined resource of data and analytics for the automotive industry. The integrated organization operates under the J.D. Power name and includes the brands Autodata Solutions, ChromeData and UnityWorks. As our collective company expands, we continue to build upon our industry-leading source of automotive data, analytics and software solutions.

We’re proud of what we do. At Autodata Solutions, we transform complex data into marketing and sales solutions for the automotive industry. Our innovative technologies enable industry partners to optimally support and promote sales. For over 30 years Autodata Solutions has been a trusted and proven partner to the automotive industry. We house over 700 employees throughout five locations in Canada and the U.S.

When you work for Autodata Solutions, you join a team of dedicated professionals who look for new ways to raise the bar. Our corporate culture is results focused, and our offices are informal with the goal of inspiring collaboration and outside-the-box thinking. It takes talent and ambition to meet the challenges of our rapidly evolving market — and that’s all part of the fun.

To all recruitment agencies: Autodata Solutions does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Senior Analyst, QA
Description:
Canada's Challenger Bank™
Equitable Bank manages over $35 billion in assets and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Equitable Group Inc. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company and has become Canada’s ninth largest Schedule I bank. Equitable Bank offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending, and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs.

At Equitable, we have no doubt that financial services are changing. Consumers increasingly prefer to interact remotely through digital channels and are less likely to visit brick and mortar locations. That’s why we launched EQ Bank in 2016. Its approach to simple and convenient banking makes it a strong contender in the industry. We believe there’s an opportunity for something different, to provide better service and a better deal for our customers through digital banking.

Job Title: Senior QA Analyst

Department: Retail and Commercial Lending Technology

Reports To: Technology Delivery Lead

Purpose of Job

The Senior QA Analyst is a key member of the team responsible for supporting the planning, design and execution of all software testing activities within Equitable Bank . The Senior QA Analyst will work collaboratively within the IT department and other business units to ensure that Project QA needs and tasks are identified and executed with agreed upon quality metrics .The Senior QA Analyst will analyze project artifacts to identify test requirements, design and execute test scripts, and participate in the defect process from reporting to monitoring to resolution.The Senior QA Analyst will also support business acceptance and user acceptance testing.

Main Activities
Create and manage testing strategy, estimates and test plans for Project Delivery
Review business requirements with the product owner and end users and clarify any ambiguity ensuring testing conditions are understood
Develop and execute test cases within the agreed upon timelines ensuring the application is performing as expected
Assess and escalate critical & high impact quality issues to the Technology Delivery Lead or Project Lead
Review test deliverables, manage defects and document test results
Participate in defect review meetings and provide analysis as required
Assist in the validation of newly created testing environments in coordination with vendors and IT
Troubleshoot and review logs/queues as required to analyze potential defects
Assist Technology Delivery Lead or Project Manager in creating status and progress reports and testing metrics as required
Follow prescribed change control procedures, making sure all changes are properly documented, approved and communicated


Knowledge/Skill Requirements
4+years of experience with creating Test Strategies, Test Plans and Project QA artifacts
3+ years of Financial Institution Experience
Good understanding of SDLC and of Agile/Scrum software development process
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies
Ability to interact effectively within a cross functional team


Additional Nice To Have Skills
Strong skills in using JIRA + Confluence + Zephyr
Previous experience working with Core Banking Systems
Previous experience with automated testing tools


Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position

Apply Now

Title: Data analyst
Developer, BI
Industry: Financial Services Banking
Description:
Job Description

Founded in 1846, Laurentian Bank Financial Group (LBCFG) is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").

With more than 2,900 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers. With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.

This role sits within LBC Tech, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Enterprise Data Warehouse, the incumbent is responsible for the development, testing and maintenance of the core Business Intelligence components of the bank's Enterprise Data Warehouse, including but not limited to; ad-hoc reports, data extracts, and analytic cubes.

The current core BI components are based in IBM technology, and include IBM Cognos, IBM Data Manager and IBM Campaign Manager, but additional technologies may be incorporated in the future, including, but not limited to; MicroStrategy or other OLAP solutions.

Responsibilities

º Work with the BI Team Lead to understand the BI Requirements for Reports, Data Extracts, Analytic Cubes, and Dashboards
º Complete the development, testing and deployment of BI solutions, as assigned by the BICC Team Lead, including, but not limited to;
Update the functional specifications of the various developments and validate the results in cooperation with teammates and users.
Develop and maintain any additional required documentation and reference structures (including business rules, best practices, methodologies, etc.) for all BI products for which the business unit is responsible.
Develop and test the BI solutions as defined
Support the implementation of the BI solution in production
º Participate in the design and development of BI solutions for corporate initiatives, where required
º Evaluate the data quality and accuracy of the BI products
º Participate actively in deployment, post-implementation monitoring and development of all BI products and related projects.
º Ensure rigorous monitoring of development activities and solutions to ensure compliance with set deadlines and budgets.
º Help support BI production activities when required
º Keep updated on all existing and future Enterprise Data Warehouse structures, end-to-end processes and core technologies
º Perform all tasks of a similar or general nature requested by his or her superior or required for the job.

Qualifications

º University degree or diploma (or certification) in computer science, business intelligence, or related field, or equivalent work experience.
º 2 + years related experience in a similar role as a BI or OLAP Analyst / Developer.
º Knowledge, skills and experience working on EDW/BI projects and/or operational teams, within Oracle and/or SQL Server database environments.
º Knowledge, skills and experience with SQL, and writing SQL queries.
º Knowledge, skills and experience as an OLAP Developer, creating analytic cubes, reports and dashboards with IBM Cognos, or other OLAP tools.
º Demonstrated knowledge, skills and experience documenting BI functional and technical requirements.
º Demonstrated knowledge, skills and experience working with data sets, and performing data analysis.
º Dynamic, autonomous/resourceful and focused on results.
º Focused on teamwork and collaboration.
º Bilingual in English and French would be an asset.
º Knowledge and experience with SAS, and predictive modelling tools would be an asset.
º Knowledge of the banking industry would be an asset.

Additional Information

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground. Accommodations for persons with disabilities are available upon request for job applicants taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Title: Business Analyst
Industry: Marketing & Advertising Computer Software Internet
Description:
About Us

Join an established, scaling and award-winning team at Trulioo (Truly-you)! Recognized as a “CNBC Disruptor 50 Company”, “Technology Pioneers” by the World Economic Forum, “Emerging Company of the Year” by the BC Tech Association, and KNOW Identity’s “Industry Leader of the Year!”

We are a Silicon Valley-funded tech company solving the problems of trust and safety online. To realize that goal we’ve built the world’s leading identity verification platform, enabling instant verification of 5 billion people and 330 million businesses in more than 100 countries through a single API. Hundreds of businesses worldwide depend on Trulioo GlobalGateway to help streamline and scale their customer onboarding, fraud prevention, and compliance operations across the world. We are headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, have a satellite office in Dublin, Ireland, and are expanding our US teams in both San Diego and Austin. Our competitive advantage is, and always will be, our people.

Position Summary

:

Reporting to the Manager of Data Science, the Business Analyst is responsible for helping our customers make data-driven decisions and derive maximum value from Trulioo’s service offering. This includes data analysis, visualization, outcome-based recommendations as well as client-facing presentations and collaboration across Trulioo’s business teams.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct data studies to evaluate customer performance and apply critical thinking to assess, determine options, and make outcome-based recommendations.
Tell powerful stories from extracted and analyzed data to our enterprise customers using a variety of visual aids, interactive dashboards, and/or written reports.
Analyze data to identify trends, exceptions, and areas for further investigation.
Communicate with internal and external stakeholders both orally and in writing, to translate complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Contribute to the improvement and automation of analytic processes to help the team scale efficiently.
Key/Technical Skills:
Experience in gathering, cleaning, analyzing, and reporting on data; including a demonstrated ability to identify appropriate statistical analysis for large datasets, visualization of the data, and measurement objectives.
3+ years in a reporting and data analysis position.
3+ years experience or equivalent working with relational databases in a SQL environment
3+ years experience or equivalent creating and presenting reports using a Business Intelligence tool, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Looker, etc.
Proficient in MS Excel; able to perform pivot tables, pivot charts, and advanced functions in MS Excel and other visualization tools
Strong problem solving ability and is able to logically analyze, identify root causes and provide effective solutions with a high level of detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills - ability to work within a team environment.
Ability to work in a customer-oriented, fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Bonus: experience working with a scripting language such as Python or R in a combination of professional and/or self-taught environment.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor degree in Business with a quantitative specialization, bachelor degree in a quantitative area such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Working at Trulioo

A great place to work! Trulioo offers a fast-paced, dynamic, inclusive work environment where all employees have an impact. You will be challenged to achieve, develop, and grow as part of a hyper-growth company.

We offer you the opportunity to make a difference and create a better world by revolutionizing how technology, trust, and identity intersect online. We are on a mission to make sure no one is left behind and everyone has the opportunity to participate fully in the modern digital economy. In order to do this well, diversity and inclusion have always been fundamental to our mission, our culture and our life. Trulioo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity and experience connects us with the customers and communities we serve, attracting top talent and passionate changemakers across the globe. Our mission matters – for billions of people everywhere. At Trulioo, we truly believe “everyone is someone” and we invite you to join our mission and celebrate the positive change we are making in the world.

Trulioo offers competitive compensation and extended benefits package including dental, vacation and learning opportunities and programs. Title: Data Engineer III
Industry: Internet Information Technology & Services
Description:
Who We Are And What We Do

SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our mission is to power the curious and enable organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500, to transform feedback into action. Our brand is beloved and well known throughout the world—over 6 billion people have taken a SurveyMonkey survey! Today, more than 17 million active users rely on our platform to measure and understand feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and the market. And our enterprise-grade products and solutions enable 335,000+ organizations globally to solve daily challenges—from delivering better customer experiences to increasing employee retention.

What We're Looking For

You will report directly to our Director of Data Engineering for SurveyMonkey, and you will be a part of our Global data team which is the centralized data team for the Enterprise and is the source of Data for all departments like Finance, and Marketing. We are looking for a data engineer to join a team of experienced data engineers and data architects to build and manage the end-to-end data pipelines (batch and streaming) using modern cloud technologies. This is a role in the central data organization at SurveyMonkey that provides applicable insights.

You will
Design, architect and build data pipelines to support existing data models
Data quality: build quality checks in the end-to-end data pipelines
Build new Data models (Fact vs Dimension). Write performant/idempotent transformations in Snowflake
Build data pipeline using Python scripting (in a modular/loop context) Write well-tested, production ready code in Python and/or Snowflake SQL
Experience implementing ETL (or ELT) best practices
Translate requirements, to technical specifications, form project scope, and achieve deployable code.
Write complex data engineering Snowflake - SQL jobs that perform queries on the entirety of our datasets
You have
5+ years experience in data engineering and Data warehousing technologies
3+ years experience in Snowflake/ETL
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools using Airflow, Luigi
Experience with AWS cloud services: S3, EC2, RDS
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, Scala
Experience scheduling, automating and deploying production data pipelines using Airflow/Luigi
Experience with tools such as DBT, Matillion or Talend other similar technologies
Experience transforming, developing data structures, metadata, dependency and data workflows to support an Analytics function
Deep knowledge of Data lakes, EDW concepts, data modeling (Star, Snowflake and Galaxy schemas)
What We Offer Our Employees

SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By promoting inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can excel. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals.

SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and we have also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC's Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100.

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace

SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.

Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Industry: Mental Health Care Health, Wellness & Fitness Hospital & Health Care
Description:
Make a difference in a growing, innovative mental health organization and centre of excellence in people-centered care. Work with supportive colleagues who are passionate about improving lives and champions for quality and continuous learning.

Position Summary

As a Data Engineer, you will be an integral part of a collaborative team focused on delivering seamless services to our clients and customers. If you are looking for a company that is constantly moving forward in pursuit of successful outcomes, get ready to love it here!

Hours of Work: Permanent Full-Time, 37.5 hours per week

What You'll Be Doing
Develop insightful analytics and business intelligence within all of our business streams by collaborating with stakeholder groups to meet strategic objectives
Initiate, coordinate and ‘own’ your own projects from start to finish
Proactively provide solutions to issues through innovative and analytical thinking
Work simultaneously on multiple projects at various stages of completion
Master a variety of reporting tools and programming languages
Collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to produce documentation for data sources, data models, source to target mapping and KPI definitions
Support the achievement of sustainable practices
What We're Looking For
Degree or Diploma in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration or a related discipline
Familiarity with, and understanding of, programming language concepts and visual design principles and SSRS and PowerBI
Organized, meticulous and detail oriented
Expert user of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
Experience developing reports in SQL Server Reporting Services and Power BI
Expertise in data retrieval and manipulation from relational or multi-dimensional databases
Experience creating and troubleshooting SQL queries and stored procedures on various database platforms
Minimum 3 years of proven analyst experience in a similar role
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, French language is an asset
Why work with us

Homewood Health is Canada’s largest and leading service provider for medically focused, evidence-based treatment of mental health and addiction disorders. Our organizational culture values service excellence, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Our people make a difference!

Homewood Health Inc. is committed to ensuring that its teams reflect the diversity of our community and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. In accordance with the various provincial legislations that we operate under, Homewood Health is committed to working in collaboration with any team member who may require workplace accommodation in order to successfully perform any or all aspects of their role. Join us at Homewood Health™ and be part of a diverse team helping Canadians live healthier, more productive and fulfilling lives.

Title: Data Analyst (12-month contract)
Industry: Biotechnology Medical Device Research
Description:
Job Description Summary

Responsible for supporting program management, technical service and channel partners in data analytics, dashboard creation and administrative areas.

Job Description

Be part of something bigger!

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.

About The Role

As Data Analyst (12-month contract), you will be supporting a large medical capital equipment program to drive operational excellence in order to achieve program and strategic objectives. You'll play a critical part in working closely with program management to drive data organization, analytics, dashboard creation and business metrics/analytics. The focus for this role is to determine the appropriate master data structure for the program, perform data cleaning and manipulation, determine how the data will be used and produce the proper data visualization through creation of master dashboard(s), where needed. You'll drive better decision making through program operations enhancement, data quality maintenance, demand planning and key program metrics reporting. Additionally, this role will perform advanced excel manipulation, database design and dashboard mapping. This includes data mining, data structure building, quantifying, evaluating, and transforming internal and external information into business intelligence to further drive the achievement of program objectives.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
Gather reporting requirements, build new capabilities, maintain data quality and generate data visualization dashboards; and
Data cleaning, manipulation, and building data structure, while determining the data structure and how it will be utilized; validation and program dashboard creation to ensure data accuracy and usability and self-service dashboarding capabilities as required.
Determine how data can be leveraged to ensure efficient operations planning, customer scheduling and parts demand planning for supply chain.
Create program dashboards and integrate using Excel & Power BI for operational reporting to program stakeholders.
Drive the design of database tables and structures by creating views, functions and stored procedures; including writing optimized queries for potential integration with other applications
Provide frequent program reporting and track performance to targets (schedule, demand planning, parts forecasting, etc.) for program management stakeholders.
Support Program leaders in managing planning requirements, device tracking as well as parts forecasting and reporting.
Performs other data maintenance related duties and assignments as required; perform other ad hoc business analytics as required.
Operational planning
About You

To be successful in this role, you require advanced proficiency with Excel and Power BI (a must). Qlikview, BI/BW and Access experience is an asset. You possess a keen business sense, with the ability to work in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment. You are detail oriented, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and program focused.

You will connect with multiple stakeholder groups to gather data requirements and generate reporting outputs, and must possess superb communications and interpersonal skills. You also take pride in what you do by being self-directed to accomplish goals and timelines, with excellent organizational and prioritization skills.

Education And Experience Required
Minimum 5 years professional relevant experience with at least 2 years focused on data manipulation, data structure building and dashboard creation.
Bachelor's degree required, computer science or data analytics field preferred.
Click on Apply if this sounds like you!

Why join us?

A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day.

You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.

To learn more about BD visit https://jobs.bd.com/

Great Place to Work® has certified our workplace culture based on your feedback in the Trust Index® survey, and we've just published the news about us on their social media channels. You can check these out here. And if you think your friends and networks would be interested in knowing more about your workplace, sharing these posts is a great way to give them some insight!

Becton Dickinson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from individuals with a wide range of abilities and provide an accessible candidate experience. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Canadian Human Rights Act, Becton Dickinson will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform us of any accommodation(s) you require by contacting HR at 1-855-234-3577.

Typically deals with variable issues with potential
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

Ability to manage and prioritize multiple assignments, and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast-paced environment

Description:

1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Title: Data Engineer/Consultant
Industry: Marketing & Advertising
Description:
Company Description

Cardinal Path, part of dentsu, is a leading digital analytics and digital marketing firm focused on delivering insight, understanding and outcomes that create competitive advantage for our clients. We engage at the strategic, business, and technical levels to generate tangible and quantifiable value for our partners. Our clients include brands such as Bridgestone, Johnson and Johnson, Pfizer, Asics and hundreds of others. Cardinal Path’s mission is: To know. To Share. To be our Partners’ competitive advantage. And our company culture reflects the importance of our people’s’ expertise, wellness and happiness in everything we do.

Job Description

The Data Science Consultant (Data Engineer) will have proven expertise in system architecture, database design, data integrations, and be an expert in SQL and Python. Experience with delivering in big data platforms such as Google BigQuery, Microsoft Azure SQL DB/Synapse, or Amazon Redshift is essential. Expertise with traditional RDBMS platforms such as SQL Server or Oracle and NoSQL and Hadoop environments would complement. Data integration experience using ETL platforms such as AirFlow, Talend, Alteryx, or Fivetran is important.

Experience

in the digital data and analytic ecosystem and intermediate knowledge in Web Analytic tools (Google Analytics or the Adobe Marketing Cloud), and API expertise is a major plus!!
Act as primary consultant to clients for data engineering services, managing the client relationship and coordinating across other support and consultant roles
Estimate projects involving data integration, data architecture, business analysis or application development and collaborate with sales and client success teams to grow accounts
Participate in product roadmap discussions and identifying key areas for improvement of products and services
Collect client project requirements, focusing on needs & impacts and necessary technical outcomes
Create solution designs to solve for clients business and technical needs while keeping within budget
Produce documentation of data pipeline design and solution architecture for data warehousing and ETL, following Cardinal Path's documentation standards
Create datasets, extracts, or views of data that will be consumed by teams of analysts and data scientists to support data mining, analytics, reporting, and dashboards
Develop, implement, and support methodologies, standards, and tools for data management, considering innovation and data security
Create ongoing standards and process for overall data architecture team, including developing governance, support and testing models
Perform exploratory data validation with analysts to ensure quality data standards are in place and ensure data integrity during all transformation steps.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics or related field quantitative field, required with a minimum of 3-5 years experience with database development
Experience with cloud / big data technologies such as BigQuery, Azure SQL DB/Synapse, Amazon Redshift is required
Experience with relational database systems including SQL Server, Oracle, MySql, Postgres
Advanced skills in data scripting and database development technologies (SQL, Python, R)
Deep knowledge of ETL tools and how they can be applied to a big data environment
Familiarity with analyzing digital marketing, advertising and ecommerce data
API expertise for Google Analytics, Facebook, Twitter, etc. is a plus
Familiarity with web analytics tools such as Adobe Marketing Cloud or Google Analytics
Experience with building and maintaining DevOps workflows
Experience with optimizing BI or visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, DOMO or Power BI
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud
Familiar with NoSql database technologies such as MongoDB
Knowledge of technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, and Airflow
3+ years experience in marketing technology/data/analytics roles
Additional Information

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best.

If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Canada.Recruitment@dentsuaegis.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst - Nutaku
Description:
Nutaku is the world’s largest English gaming platform dedicated to 18+ titles. The rebellious and multi-stimulating gaming platform was born in January of 2015 with the launch of our first three PC games. We have since grown to become the largest free-to-play browser and adult gaming platform in the world, boasting 400+ games for both PC and Mobile, 40 million players, and over 100 million visits per month

What You'll Be Doing

We are looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst who loves data and has a great mind for surfacing insightful visualizations of their research. Working within the CRM team you will:
Improve tracking of marketing campaigns and platform KPIs.
Study current data sources to develop accurate reporting.
Develop and present dashboards that highlight results and trends.
Conduct deep dive analysis into channel performance, Player segmentation and targeting.
Develop our ability to understand, segment, engage, convert and otherwise optimize our consumers’ journey through intense A/B testing.
Coordinate with other data teams preserving our data warehouse as the source of truth for Nutaku
Create monthly reports outlining the platform’s performance along with ad hoc report as requested


Must Haves

What you'll need to be successful:
3+ years of experience in a data or marketing analyst role
Graduate degree in a quantitative field is highly desired (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Engineering, Economics, Econometrics, Finance, Quantitative Marketing)
SQL, Excel and PowerBI Fluency
Strong quantitative and analytical competency and data gathering skills
A quick study on business concepts, metrics and KPIs
Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments


As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

In this role you may be exposed to adult content

Address

100 King Street West

Data Analytics & Reporting
Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Title: Data Engineer
Industry: Computer Software Internet Financial Services
Description:
About Borrowell

Borrowell is a Canadian company dedicated to making financial stability possible for everyone. The first to offer free credit scores, Borrowell provides educational resources, monitoring, innovative digital tools and personalized product recommendations to help people feel in control and optimistic about their financial future.

With over 1.5 million members, Borrowell is one of the largest fintech companies in Canada. Borrowell has won numerous awards, including being named one of the top 100 fintech companies in the world by KPMG, ranking 4th on the Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ list of fastest-growing companies in Canada, and making App Annie's list of Breakout Finance Apps for 2019.

Borrowell places a high value on building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is proud to have a gender-balanced team. Borrowell was named one of the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Canada (<100 employees), as well as one of the Best Workplaces for Mental Wellness, Women and Millennials.

About The Role

As a Data Engineer, you will be creating and maintaining the data pipelines working with latest technologies like Snowflake, Apache Airflow, Azure Functions, and Looker for business analytics, and overall getting your hands dirty with large data sets. You will be engaged in identifying, designing, and implementing process improvements for the team.

During your first year, you can expect to
Hold an impactful role in modernizing existing pipelines of our newly-acquired partner company, Refresh Financial, with which you will help integrate them into Borrowell's data systems by migrating on-premises data to cloud
Constantly evaluate our existing data engineering tech stack, looking for optimizations and improvements
Maintain the Snowflake data warehouse using DBT and Terraform
Work with internal stakeholders to collect data for measuring their key performance metrics
Design data pipelines to extract data from a variety of sources, including unstructured, semi-structured, and fully structured data


Requirements
2+ years working experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and data sets
Experience with
Relational and NoSQL databases (MongoDB/Cassandra/CosmosDB)
Query authoring (SQL) as well as practical familiarity with a variety of databases
Object-oriented and functional scripting languages (Python)
Building and maintaining data lakes

Nice to Haves
Experience working with
Apache Airflow, DBT, and Snowflake
Writing stored procedures in Snowflake
Terraform/Amazon Redshift/Google BigQuery (GBQ)
Microsoft SSIS
Microsoft ServiceBus/Amazon SQS/Google Pub/Sub
Bash/PowerShell scripting and Azure DevOps
Implementing GDPR and/or CCPA policies
Data visualization tools (Looker/Tableau)
Event hubs (Apache Kafka/Amazon Kinesis/Azure Event Hubs/Google Pub/Sub

Important Qualities
Desire to continuously learn how to implement the latest tech and analytical tools into our tech stack
A passion to improve the financial lives of Canadians through innovative use of technology and data-driven systems
Willingness to mentor others and embrace feedback
Clear, open, and transparent communication
Ambition to continuously improve self


Benefits
The Opportunity - join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
Comprehensive Health Benefits - medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family
Additional Health Benefits - virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up - available to new parents
Wellness & Transit Benefit - $600 annually to spend on a gym membership, daycare, petcare, etc.
Employee Development Benefit - $250+ annually to spend on courses, conferences, certifications, etc.
Givewell Benefit - 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
Flexibility - flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy

We will be remote-first for all of 2021. In 2022, we will implement a flexible remote policy with opportunities to work in-office.

At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you’re unsure about your qualifications for this position, we’d still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for candidates who have experience, but know that not everyone’s had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What’s most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.

Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.

Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.

Industry: Financial Services Insurance
Description:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

Job Description

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

The fast-growing Manulife Canadian Data office is hiring an associate data engineer working on advanced analytics engineering, Azure service, and AI/machine learning production in Toronto or Waterloo office

Build AI/machine learning engineering and production, including recommendation engine and real-time decision management system

required for this role is as follows:

Azure Cloud
